intro: Urera verrucosa, commonly known as the rough urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Urera verrucosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
